Package View

Class Context

java.lang.Object
View.Context
public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
Class Context

This Class is a Singleton, which is used as a shared platform between the Updater and the GameGui Controller

Author:
Tobias Celik, Hoang An Tran, Simon Wiethase

    • addFinishedPlayer

      public void addFinishedPlayer​(int id, java.lang.String name)
      When a player finishes his card selection, the other players get a notification, his Carddeck will be disabled, and the Timer will be started finished players are stored in a Hashmap, with their ID as key, and a boolean value of their status as value
      Parameters:
      id - : id of the finished player
      name - : name of the finished player

    • setRobotWithOrientation

      public void setRobotWithOrientation​(int figure, java.lang.String orientation)
      This Method is called in the "Turning" Case in the @Updater, it calculates the current Orientation of a robot and stores it in a Hashmap
      Parameters:
      figure - : figure-Number of a robot
      orientation - : the new orientation the robot faces

    • setRobot

      protected void setRobot​(int position, int figure)
      This Method calculates the X and Y Position of a Robot and stores it in a Hashmap
      Parameters:
      position - : The number of the field, where the robot have to go
      figure - : the ID of the robot

    • setRound

      public void setRound​(int round)
      This Method gets the current Round, stores it in a variable, and enables some functions, which were disabled in the former round.
      Parameters:
      round - : number of the new round

    • handleCurrentCards

      public void handleCurrentCards​(java.util.List<ActiveCard> activeCards)
      This Method gets a List of ActiveCards, which are labled with the name of the Player and the name of the Card. ActiveCards show, which Player plays which Card in the current Register, for every Round there are five Registers. The List will be processed in the doActiveCardDialogue() method. If the Player is not an AI, he has to confirm them by Clicking on a button, the AI sends automaticly a confirmation back to the Server
      Parameters:
      activeCards - : List of ActiveCards

    • doActiveCardDialogue

      protected void doActiveCardDialogue​(java.util.List<ActiveCard> activeCards)
      This Method processes the ActiveCard List, and prepares the Message, which will be shown to each Player. The Message informs every Player of the current card the other players will play in the current round.
      Parameters:
      activeCards - List of ActiveCards

    • useLastCard

      public void useLastCard()
      This Method is for the AI only. It collects all responses in a Queue and sends them out.

    • sendPlayItMessage

      protected void sendPlayItMessage()
      This Method just responses to the Server and confirms that the Player knows, which cards will be played. To be honest, I do not know we have to implement this

    • pickedUpCube

      public void pickedUpCube​(int playerID, int count, boolean fromCard)
      This Method modifies the GameBoard after an EnergyCube was picked up The EnergyCubes are just a painted orange square which appear and disappear with a binding
      Parameters:
      playerID - ID of the Player who picked up the cube. Over the ID we can determine the robot, its position and modify the correct "EnergyCube"-Binding in the GameBoardBuilder
      count - number of Energy Cubes the Player picked up
      fromCard - determines if the EnergyCube was from a card or a powerstation

    • sendStartingPoint

      public void sendStartingPoint​(int x_field, int y_field)
      This Method sends a selected Starting Point to the Server. It first checks, if the Position is already Taken. Background-Information: The Server tells every connected Client the starting Position of a Player. This Information is stored in a List in the Client-Singleton If the position is free, the Client tells the Server the Starting Position. If not, a warning window will be shown
      Parameters:
      x_field - : x-position of the Starting Point
      y_field - : y-position of the Starting Point

    • warningAlert

      public void warningAlert​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String header, java.lang.String content)
      This Method creates a Warning-Window
      Parameters:
      title - : title of the window
      header - : header of the warning
      content - : a detailed description of the problem and how to avoid it

    • sendCard

      public void sendCard​(java.lang.String cardName, int register) throws java.lang.Exception
      This Method gets the name of a Card and its Position on the programming deck It sends both Information to the Server
      Parameters:
      cardName - : name of the Cards
      register - : position of the card in the programming deck
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(int figure, java.lang.String playerName)
      This Method notifies other Players, when a player Disconnects and removes his robot from the field
      Parameters:
      figure - : ID of the Robot
      playerName - : Name of the Player

    • rewriteTileAtPosition

      public void rewriteTileAtPosition​(int position)
      This Method triggers the rewriting of a single tile on the gameboard. the main Reason: When a player moves away from a field, the overlaying Image of the Robot must be deleted, the easiest way is by rewriting the field at a current position. The rewriting happens in the GameGuiBuilder Class
      Parameters:
      position - : position of the field

    • fitCheckPointImage

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView fitCheckPointImage​(javafx.scene.image.Image image)
      This Method fits the Imag of a robots to certain Limits and transfer its format to ImageView
      Parameters:
      image - : Image of the Robot
      Returns:
      ImageView-Object of the image

    • selectDamageCards

      protected void selectDamageCards​(int xPos)
      When the Spam-Cards are over, the Player has to choose between other Damage-Cards, and sometimes he has to draw more then on Card. The Player selects a Damagecard from a clickable grid in the GameGui, triggering this method. The Method gets the position of the selected Card in the Grid, gets its name with the Switch-Case-Query, and stores it in a List. When the Size of the List reaches the number of requested Damage-Cards, a List of the selected Damage-Cards will be sent to the Server
      Parameters:
      xPos - : Position of the Damagecard in the damageCards-Grid in the GameGui

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer​(int currentPlayerId)
      This Method sets the Current Player (choosen by the Game and transmitted from the Server to all clients), notify other Players, and enables functions for the current Player exclusively
      Parameters:
      currentPlayerId - : ID of the current Player
